intro: Selago lobeliacea, commonly known as the coastal bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along coastal areas and tidal flats. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Selago lobeliacea is often found in salt marshes and is adapted to tolerate brackish water conditions.
